item.title: Acronis introduces the latest version of its software, Acronis True Image 2019
item.description:

Acronis Active Protection, powered by AI, effectively combats ransomware threats. Acronis Notary and ASign leverage blockchain technology to guarantee data integrity through notarization and e-signatures. Enhanced backup solutions now extend protection to social media profiles. item.title: Asia is included in global ransomware attacks
item.description:
WannaCrypt, also referred to as WannaCry or WCry, holds data files hostage and demands a $300 USD ransom in Bitcoin. The ransom message warns that the payment will double after three days. If payment isn’t received within seven days, the encrypted files are permanently deleted. A key feature of WannaCrypt is its ability to self-propagate within company networks without any user intervention. This is achieved by exploiting a known weakness in the Microsoft Windows operating system...

item.title: Kaspersky provides solutions to combat ransomware
item.description:
Ransomware is increasingly targeting businesses, encrypting files and demanding payment for decryption keys. A Kaspersky Lab report reveals a six-fold increase in ransomware attacks against businesses from 2015 to 2016, affecting one in ten business users. Cybercriminals are focusing on businesses, particularly small and medium-sized companies. A Kaspersky Lab and B2B International study found that 42% of respondents from these businesses considered ransomware a major threat. Even brief data unavailability can severely impact small businesses, potentially halting operations entirely...
